template:
Translate the following {fromLanguage} story to {toLanguage}, adapted for {difficulty} CEFR level:

Instructions:
{instructions}

Specific {toLanguage} Guidelines:
{languageInstructions}

{nativeToTargetInstructions}

{fromLanguage} Story:
{text}

RESPONSE FORMAT:
Return a JSON object with the following structure:
{
  "translation": "<full translated {toLanguage} story text>",
  "words": [
    {
      "to_word": "<word from the translated {toLanguage} story>",
      "to_lemma": "<lemma/base form of the {toLanguage} word>",
      "from_word": "<corresponding word from the original {fromLanguage} story>",
      "from_lemma": "<lemma/base form of the original {fromLanguage} word>",
      "pos": "<part of speech: noun|verb|adjective|adverb|pronoun|preposition|conjunction|interjection|article|determiner|other>",
      "difficulty": "<CEFR level: A1|A2|B1|B2|C1|C2>",
      "to_definition": "<context-appropriate definition of the {toLanguage} word based on how it's used in THIS SPECIFIC CONTEXT>"
    }
  ]
}

CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:
- Include EVERY single word from the TRANSLATED {toLanguage} story in the 'words' array
- Include ALL words: nouns, verbs, adjectives, adverbs, articles, pronouns, prepositions, conjunctions - everything
- If a word appears multiple times in the story, include a separate entry for EACH occurrence
- Each duplicate word entry must have a context-specific definition based on how it's used at that particular position in the story
- Maintain exact word order matching the translated story from first word to last
- The 'to_definition' should define the {toLanguage} word as it's specifically used in this context (e.g., "run" in "run a business" vs "run a race" should have different definitions)
- Each word object represents a single word occurrence from the translated story, not the original
- The 'from_word' shows what it was in the original {fromLanguage} text at that position
- Use standard part-of-speech tags based on the {toLanguage} word's function in the sentence
- Assign difficulty levels based on the {toLanguage} word complexity and CEFR standards
- Return ONLY valid JSON, no additional text or markdown formatting
